ATD111.name: Basic Apparel Structuring
ATD111.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ATD111.description: Fundamentals of apparel structuring. Students enrolled in the course may complete the course requirements by passing a competency exam.

ATD121.name: Explorations in Apparel and Textile Design
ATD121.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ATD121.description: Art and design fundamentals applied to apparel design. Visual communication of design ideas through apparel and textile rendering. Design process, fashion theory, fabrication and exploration of two- and three-dimensional designing.
ATD121.prerequisite: STA 110 and STA 112 and STA 113 and STA 114

ATD222.name: Structuring, Couture and Tailored Garments
ATD222.description: Advanced methods of garment assembly and fabric handling. Creative application of assembly techniques; tailoring and couture methods.

ATD231.name: Textile Materials
ATD231.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ATD231.description: Formation and properties of fibers, yarns, structure, finish, color and design of fabrics. Textile specification and selection for end-use performance.

ATD323.name: Apparel Pattern Design
ATD323.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ATD323.description: Pattern design from standard templates and body measurements. Introduction to design studio environment. Creation of original designs.

ATD325.name: Design by Draping
ATD325.description: Execution of original designs by fabric manipulation on a form. Evaluation of fit, drape, and balance.
ATD325.prerequisite: ATD 222 and ATD 231 and (ATD 323 or concurrently)

ATD332.name: Textile Design
ATD332.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ATD332.description: Textile design technology for surface design, knit and woven fabric development. Design organization, elements and principles.

ATD335.name: Design Development and Presentation
ATD335.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ATD335.description: Technological exploration and creation of designs, technical drawings, storyboard presentations, and electronic portfolio.

ATD423.name: Design Methods and Approaches
ATD423.description: Research and execution of original apparel design across a variety of platforms and experimental approaches.

ATD423S.name: Senior Project in Design Methods and Approaches
ATD423S.description: Intensive research project focused on conceptual issues in design.
ATD423S.restrictions: Open to seniors in the Apparel and Textile Design major. Approval of department.

ATD424.name: Specialized Design
ATD424.description: Implications of innovative technologies for the future of design, art, and manufacturing. Utilization of technologies to create innovative and highly complex designs. Practical experiences within technologies. Workflow scenarios including concept, drawing, modeling, production, and presentation.

ATD426.name: History of Dress and Textiles
ATD426.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ATD426.description: History of dress and textiles as a reflection of the cultural milieu.

ATD427.name: Knitwear Design
ATD427.description: Fundamentals of knitwear design. Patternmaking and assembly techniques for cut-and-sew and full-fashioned knitwear.

ATD427S.name: Senior Project in Knitwear Design
ATD427S.description: Intensive research project focused on knitwear design.
ATD427S.restrictions: Open to seniors in the Apparel and Textile Design major. Approval of department.

ATD428.name: Design Studio
ATD428.description: Execution of original apparel designs for a collection and exhibition.

ATD428S.name: Senior Project in Design Studio
ATD428S.description: Intensive research project focused on individual collections and exhibition of design.
ATD428S.restrictions: Open to seniors in the Apparel and Textile Design major. Approval of department.

ATD430.name: Dress, Culture and Human Behavior
ATD430.description: Dress as an expression of self and reflection of society and global cultures. Effect of dress on human behavior at the personal, interpersonal, and social organizational levels.
ATD430.restrictions: Not open to freshmen or sophomores.

ATD431.name: Global Context for Sustainable Design
ATD431.description: Global patterns of apparel and textile production, distribution, and consumption. Employment practices and international trade policy. Natural resource use and its impact on sustainable design. Design process for sustainable apparel design.
ATD431.restrictions: Not open to freshmen or sophomores.

ATD439.name: Portfolio Development and Exhibition (W)
ATD439.description: Apparel and textile design philosophies, roles and ethics. Professional portfolio and exhibition(s). Capstone course.
ATD439.prerequisite: (ATD 323) and completion of Tier I writing requirement

ATD490.name: Independent Study
ATD490.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
ATD490.description: Independent study of selected topics in apparel and textile design.
ATD490.restrictions: Not open to freshmen or sophomores. Approval of department.

ATD490H.name: Honors Independent Study
ATD490H.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
ATD490H.description: Independent study of selected topics in apparel and textile design.
ATD490H.restrictions: Open to students in the Honors College. Approval of department.

ATD491A.name: Special Topics in Apparel
ATD491A.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ATD491A.description: Special topics supplementing regular course offerings.
ATD491A.restrictions: Not open to freshmen or sophomores. Approval of department.

ATD491T.name: Special Topics in Textiles
ATD491T.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ATD491T.description: Special topics supplementing regular course offerings.
ATD491T.restrictions: Not open to freshmen or sophomores. Approval of department.

ATD491TS.name: Senior Project in Special Topics: Textiles
ATD491TS.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ATD491TS.description: Intensive research project focused on individual textile design.
ATD491TS.restrictions: Open to seniors in the Apparel and Textile Design major. Approval of department.

ATD493.name: Internship in Apparel and Textiles
ATD493.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
ATD493.description: Pre-professional experience in a selected business, industry, or community organization.
